channel.title: Mitb.moparisthebest.com (IRC) down
channel.description:
I just got off the phone with the host, the datacenter pulled the plug on him and he doesn't know for sure when or if he will get it turned back on. That also means I can't get my files off of it to start it back up someplace else. Until the situation gets sorted out, I am going to stop irc.moparisthebest.com from sending people to mitb.moparisthebest.com.
In the meanwhile, can anyone point me to a reliable, affordable IRC hosting plan? Preferably in the USA and/or Australia, not in England (we already have 2 servers there)

item.title: Mitb.moparisthebest.com (IRC) down
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Dans The Man, post:34, topic:270325”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=356781.msg2767270#msg2767270 date=1240885947]

…and it’s back up! I still may get some australian hosting though.

Get it get it get it!

Make sure its in Sydney tho.

I found a good one http://www.aushost.net.au/web_hosting.php, the bronze one is fine i think

Web hosting is entirely different than IRC hosting.

No, but apparently you can host IRC stuffs off that website ^^

Where do you read that? And how would I do it without a shell account?
[/quote]
Here. And i don’t know how to setup an IRC server >.<

Oh wait, that’s VPS hosting…[/quote]

Gotcha, but you linked to the web hosting page, which is why I didn’t see that.

I found a similar host for $29 AUS (approx $20 US) if I wanted to do it, but since there really aren’t that many and no need for it I will hold off for now.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb.moparisthebest.com (IRC) down
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:25, topic:270325”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=356781.msg2757197#msg2757197 date=1240277530]
What IRCd do you all use? If I were willing to host an IRC Server (Which I’m more than capable of doing, resource/intelligence wise). Would you all allow me to be part of the network?
[/quote]

In my opinion we don’t need any more leaves. Its totally up to everyone else though I guess.[/quote]

We don’t really need any more in the eastern US or england, but a server in the Western US or Australia would be good to have. I am not going to get one in australia yet because mine in chicago came back up, so there is not really a need as of now.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb.moparisthebest.com (IRC) down
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Creme de la Creme:

Then what’s wrong with home hosting? (I’m not being a dick I honestly don’t know the reasons against it)

Backup generators, cold clean rooms, a decent internet connection (your bt dsl would not host a satisfactory ircd, whatever you say :P)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 21, 2009, 10:40:53 am[/size][hr][quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:24, topic:270325”]What IRCd do you all use? If I were willing to host an IRC Server (Which I’m more than capable of doing, resource/intelligence wise). Would you all allow me to be part of the network?[/quote]

item.title: Mitb.moparisthebest.com (IRC) down
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

I thought you could host but just on a different port? I’m sure if they didn’t allow inbound connections at all the UK population wouldn’t be as vulnerable to attacks by viruses but they would all complain loudly about not being able to host a game or something.

A home internet connection COULD host irc. The upload bandwidth sucks (20KB/s here) but given its just text messages with a maximum size of 512 Bytes it shouldn’t be a big issue. The biggest issue for me is a sucky 300ms lag. Hops between the US and the eastern states are almost instant but hops between Western Australia and the eastern states are slow as hell. Again its only text strings that require little to no processing to be displayed so might not be an issue. For others reliability might be the most important issue.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Hosting it on your own computer? I guess the biggest reason against it is that most ISPs do not allow it. Other reasons include power consumption, low upload bandwidth, and my computer is too obnoxiously loud and bright at night to leave running all the time.

[quote=“Niall, post:14, topic:270325”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=356781.msg2729452#msg2729452 date=1238607965]

The lowest VPS would easily meet the needs of the IRC server, and at about $20 USD it isn’t a bad price.

I have no experience of IRC server hosting, How much bandwidth does it use on average to host a server with the same traffic as mitb.moparscape.com?
[/quote]

Hardly any, same for system resources.[/quote]

Then what’s wrong with home hosting? (I’m not being a dick I honestly don’t know the reasons against it)
